description: On July 12 1992, Windsor's first Lesbian and Gay Pride Day parade was held here. The city council did an official declaration of support. It was founded by Jamie Pitts, and the theme for the parade was “Get Used to It”. Other members of the founding committee included David Grenier, David Jakoby, and Marie-France Jean. The site stretched from JB's Bar and Grill (indoors and parking lot), to Kildare/Wyandotte (the current Kildare House). The Man and Woman of the Year were Jim Monk and Diane Skomash, respectively.
